comment: I hope the music school will replace him

This professor is terrible. Did not work with scheduling and favors students. I had symposium and I had to do mandatory observations for my EDU class. He would not excuse 2 absences because I needed to pass a separate course because the entire music system is BS.

He is not very inspirational and it is very obvious within his classes and ensemble through the environment he has set. He guilt-trips his students when they do not meet his expectations and then does not acknowledge when students work hard and are exceeding expectations. I have tried to understand him as a professor but have not been successful.

The worst class I have ever taken at KSU!! The lectures are boring and he doesnt make it exciting at all. Just a very boring way to teach. Paying to go to a required performance is BS and shouldnt be a thing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Get ready to have the most boring lectures of your life! So boring subjects that no one cares about. 2 performances are required for which you have to PAY for the tickets! So you are paying to get a grade! Dont take Mr. Parker!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Parker was great for this course it was a 33% hybrid. I would totally recommend taking this class to anyone who is interested in music history. There are a lot of HW, but they're very easy. There are 6 tests and the lowest one is dropped. Be prepared for long lectures though. Overall, the class is very straightforward and not too overwhelming.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Participation matters a lot if you show up the class is much easier. He makes the lectures very interesting and interactive. ALL the homework is a completion grade so do it and you will pass. The tests are super hard but if you do all the hw but fail most of the tests you can still pass with a B. Overall he is super fun and explains really well

An easy A if you show up to class since there are in class quizzes. Hes talks a lot, so you may end up tuning him out. As long as you do the assignments (in-class quizzes, tests, performances, listening quizzes) youll be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: easy class, but there are 5+0 in-class quizzes, 50+ listening quizzes done outside class, 4 exams, 3 concerts. everything's online. buying the textbook is unnecessary but you need it only for the listening quizzes. he talks TOO much so you end up tuning him out. attendance: mandatory or your quiz grades don't count if you take a quiz outside class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took this class during maymester and it was terrible. He's a great professor, the class is easy, there's just a lot of listening quizzes but he drops the lowest six. He talks so much that I just speed stopped listening.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Class wasn't hard, but it was not very interesting to me. I love music but he kind of talked about every boring part of music. You take daily quizzes (not hard) so you need to go to class as much as possible, 6 were dropped though. Email if you're sick. Not a bad professor, just hard to sit through the lectures. Also you have to go to performances

He is a good professor. He has quizzes in class everyday and listening quizzes outside of class. The tests are online and are pretty easy. I made an A in his class without difficulty and he drops the lowest grades.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Easy A if you just show up and pay attention.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Scary

clear in what needs to be done to pass. learn the vocab and genres and you'll pass. quizzes basically every day on a laptop or smartphone (I think he allows phones for quizzes??? but he is serious about know phones in class and WILL kick you out) but sometimes there's multiple quizzes per day but it is open note and open book. he's a nice guy

Dr. Parker is easy to work with. (with in reason) you take a quiz everyday but you can  use anything. might be a little boring at times but my class was 50 min so it was not that bad. I would take his class again.
He make sure you come to class everyday by having quizzes everytime the class meets! It is an easy class, however its very boring to sit through.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Parker is really nice and caring. 53 quizzes, 6 exams-all online. Required to attend 3 performances. Drops 6 lowest quiz grades and 1 of your lowest test grades. Attendance is mandatory because you take about 2-3 open-note quizzes per class. A lot of the material is on Quizlet so studying is easier. Show up for class and you'll make an A.

Pros: 2-3  open note quizzes per class (grade booster) Cons: must attend 3 performances even if already in a musical ensemble, performances must come from a set list, does not compromise on the performances you get credit for if you have a class conflict or a family emergency  very easy class but Parker took on an indifferent attitude to any issues
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Parker is pleasant and well respected.  He's an excellent conductor and knows his material. With an orchestra of 60+ students, he easily remembers everybody's name and makes effort to learn about you personally. If you need help or advice, he would give it to you. I recommend taking this class if you are skilled in a orchestral instrument.

It's really easy to receive an A in his class. All quizzes are open book and he also drops the 6 lowest quiz grades. Attendance is mandatory because you will have at least 2 quizzes a day. Each chapter has a quiz. Take good notes on the slides he talks over. Unit exams are slick hard. Especially the listenings, but rest is multiple choice.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: It's really to get an A in the class. You have to go to 2 campus concerts and 1 professional concert. There are 6 tests. There's a quiz for every chapter in the book. Most of them are open book and others are taken in the class. The class is boring,  and you're there for most of the time.

This class is mandatory and Mr. Parker knows you're in the class because you have to be, not because you want to be. This class is  super easy A if you take the time to do the quizzes. There's like 50 of them. All open book, along with the tests. 3 performances to attend. Drops a test and 6 of the billion quizzes.

Dr. Parker is the worst conductor I've ever played for. He does not respect the students' freedom at all. The orchestra is treated like middle schoolers, not upcoming professionals. He yells, curses, and shows up to rehearsals unprepared. He makes more mistakes than the orchestra does and becomes angry when the orchestra does not follow his mistake

Dr. Parker is a really smart guy, and he knows his stuff. His lectures are always long and they usually take the whole class and they're just repetitive of the book, which you have to read to do the quizzes on D2L. The unit exams are easy if you did the quizzes and studied from the book just MAKE SURE TO KNOW THE MUSIC FROM THE BOOK. No final.

-Quizzes for every chapter of the textbook -lectures to the very last second of class, just talks about the material & doesn't actually teach anything -group listening quizzes during class for participation grade -read chapters and know the music for listening portion of exams -buy the eBook
